channel.title: Gary Ryan What Really Matters For Professional Development
channel.description: This series is for senior and developing leaders who want to develop the skills required to achieve high performance. Maintaining a high level of Employability or Transferable skills are paramount for professional, personal and career success. This Podcast series explores and explains the broad range of key skills that are required to create teams, departments and organisations that matter! Visit www.orgsthatmatter.com for more information.

image.title: Gary Ryan What Really Matters For Professional Development

channel.itunes:author: Gary Ryan
channel.itunes:summary: This series is for career professionals. Maintaining a high level of Employability or Transferable skills are paramount for professional, personal and career success. This Podcast series explores and explains the broad range of key skills that are included in the concept of Employability and Transferable skills as they relate to career professionals. If you want to advance your employability, then download this series NOW! Visit http://www.orgsthatmatter.com for more information.
channel.itunes:subtitle: What Really Matters for Personal and Professional Development to accelerate your career!

item.title: Recognise, Reward and Celebrate Great Service
item.description:
Gary Ryan from Organisations That Matter explains the importance of recognising, rewarding and celebrating great service. Gary provides examples from the experience of winning national service excellence awards and asks, "How do you recognise, reward and celebrate great service?".
For more information please visit www.otmacademy.com

item.title: Leadership Insights Series Interview with Michael Josem
item.description:
As part of the Leadership Insights Series, Gary Ryan from Organisations That Matter interviews Michael Josem, Senior Manager, Game Security Team at PokerStars.com .
Michael shares insights from his journey and how he was able to turn integrity and passion into a career. Michael also explains how he uncovered an online fraud which resulted in him being interviewed on the USA 60 Minutes program and how that led to his current role.
Some of the key lessons from Michael's journey involve the importance of co-curricular activities while at university and how those activities shaped his leadership and employability.

item.title: Great service includes our value to the community
item.description: Gary Ryan explains that organisations need to consider the value that they provide to their global, regional and local communities. In doing so organisations create a sustainable relationship with their community and it is critical that they communicate the value they provide.
item.itunes:author: Gary Ryan
item.itunes:summary: Gary Ryan explains that organisations need to consider the value that they provide to their global, regional and local communities. In doing so organisations create a sustainable relationship with their community and it is critical that they communicate the value they provide.
item.media:title: Great service includes our value to the community
item.media:text: Gary Ryan explains that organisations need to consider the value that they provide to their global, regional and local communities. In doing so organisations create a sustainable relationship with their community and it is critical that they communicate the value they provide.

item.title: American express discovered that hiring processes matter
item.description: Gary Ryan explains how American Express recently changed its hiring processes for its Call Centre. They discovered that they hadn't been treating their hiring processes with the respect they deserve.

item.title: 5 Star and 2 Star Service Can Both Be Great or not!
item.description: Gary Ryan provides a practical example that highlights how 5 Star and 2 Star service levels can be both good and bad. How good is the level of service that you are providing? Is it great?

item.title: New Report Highlights Lack of Employability Skills
item.description: The United Kingdom's leading business organisation, CBI has recently released a report that highlights how disappointed employers are with regard to the employability skill development of university graduates.

item.itunes:summary: The United Kingdom's leading business organisation, CBI has recently released a report that highlights how disappointed employers are with regard to the employability skill development of university graduates.

item.title: Great Service Attracts Customers
item.description: While it isn't rocket science, many people and organisations forget that consistently providing great service attracts customers to your organisation. Referencing long time researcher and author Leonard L Berry, Gary Ryan explains this fundamental concept.
item.itunes:author: Gary Ryan
item.itunes:summary: While it isn't rocket science, many people and organisations forget that consistently providing great service attracts customers to your organisation. Referencing long time researcher and author Leonard L Berry, Gary Ryan explains this fundamental concept.
item.media:title: Great Service Attracts Customers
item.media:text: While it isn't rocket science, many people and organisations forget that consistently providing great service attracts customers to your organisation. Referencing long time researcher and author Leonard L Berry, Gary Ryan explains this fundamental concept.

item.title: Who is The Customer?
item.description: Many people don't like the term 'customer service' for good reason. However, this doesn't mean that the principles of 'service excellence' don't apply to how they go about doing their work. Gary Ryan explains how 'service excellence' enables you to exceed expectations no matter what you call your 'customers'.

item.itunes:summary: Many people don't like the term 'customer service' for good reason. Gary Ryan explains how 'service excellence' enables you to exceed expectations no matter what you call your 'customers'.

item.title: Understanding Innovation
item.description: Innovation is considered a critical factor for both individual and organisational success. Gary Ryan explains this concept in an easy to understand manner and will set you on the path to enhancing your capacity to innovate. Join Gary at http://otmacademy.com
